Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2011 10:24PM Michele1975 wrote: I am not sure about a few other things, what sort of blood tests should be done?  If the test comes back "normal", should I seek any other tests or will I be followed for a period of time?  I am just so concerned and have so many questions. Thanks for you time. Michele
Posts.Title: brand new here and totally worried! Michele1975 Michele1975

Posts.Content: Michele1975 wrote: Hello!  My name is Michele and I am just starting my journey.  here is my history I am 36 and my mother is a breast cancer and Hodgkin's survivor.  She had a double mastectomy and is doing amazing.  I have started my mammograms about 3 years ago, had my baseline at 33 and it was totally normal.  Last week I had my mammogram and they noticed something wrong, my lymp node on my left side was showing, they had me come back for a magnified Mammo, then that same day had me in for an ultra sound.  they then ordered a fine needle biopsy.  It was preformed today.  So now I wait. I am terrified.  I know that lymph nodes could be swollen for all kinds of reasons. I don't know what comes next, I don't know what kind of questions to ask.  My mom has been great, just she is the "wait and see" kind of lady and doens't want to scare me.  I am just looking for guidance. What scared me the most is the look of the lymph node on the ultra sound and mammogram machines.  It looked like a long finger on the mammo.  And it looked like a blob, with elongated ends, some fuzzy in the middle then a black outline and a bright white line, sort in the shape of a heart.  I can't get the images out of my head.  if anyone out there can make sense of it all I would be so grateful!  TIA! Michele Log in to post a reply
